alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 5:13AM PST until January 07 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to 5 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until 3 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow expected in the higher elevations with light freezing rain in lower elevations where cold air remains trapped. Snow levels will lower through the day.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
